summary: James Lerer Wolf was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from at least December 1976 to January 1979. Payroll records and certifications document his employment, salary adjustments, and title changes within the committee. These documents detail his appointments, salary adjustments, and title changes within the committee, signed by authorizing officials. He appears in multiple payroll certifications and reports, indicating his consistent employment during the committee's active period.
significance: James Lerer Wolf's significance lies in his employment within the HSCA, as documented by payroll records and certifications. While the specific nature of his work is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the committee's payroll indicates his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination.
